stem: A 10-year-old child with severe post-operative hemorrhage requires a life-saving blood transfusion. The parents, who are devout Jehovah's Witnesses, refuse to consent. Based on the documentation in the Pediatric Legal Advocacy & Ethics Board Log tab, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely legal status, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Religious refusal of emergency blood transfusion for a minor.
Background: Post-surgical abdominal bleed. Hgb 4.2. pH 7.21.
Assessment: Parents are calm but firm in their refusal: 'We cannot allow blood, it is against our faith.'
Recommendation: Immediate petition for temporary state guardianship.

tabs.title: Legal Advocacy Log
tabs.content:
Legal DoctrineStatusNotes
Parental AutonomyApplies (Initial)Parents have the right to refuse care normally.
Parens PatriaeInvoked (Emergency)State's right to protect minors from harm/death.
Judicial ConsentPending / EmergentCourt order being sought by hospital legal team.
Hgb Threshold4.2 g/dL (Critical)Life-threat established.

tabs.title: Vital Signs
tabs.content: BP 72/40, HR 158, RR 32. Child is lethargic and pale.

conditionOptions.text: Medical Neglect by the Hospital Team

actionOptions.text: Notify hospital legal and the ethics committee to obtain an emergency court order
Continue non-blood volume expanders (e.g., crystalloids) until the court order is signed
Immediately give the blood against the parents' wishes without notifying legal
Support the parents' decision and prepare to allow the child to die comfortably

parameterOptions.text: Status of the emergency court order and administrative approval
Daily measurement of fasting serum glucose
Presence of a positive Babinski sign

rationale.correct: This is a case of Parens Patriae (c2) (State protection for a minor). While competent adults can refuse life-saving care for themselves based on religion, standard medical ethics and law generally do NOT allow parents to make decisions that result in the death of their child. The nurse should facilitate the legal process for an emergency court order (a1) while maintaining volume with non-blood products (a2) until authorized. Parameters focus on the child's life-signs (p1) and the legal authorization status (p2).
clinicalPearls: Minors cannot be martyred by their parents for religious beliefs.
The hospital can obtain a temporary court order within minutes in many jurisdictions for emergencies like this.
Respect the parents' beliefs throughout the process, but the child's life is the priority.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking parents have 'Absolute' power over their child's medical care.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Autonomy is not absolute for minors. If a child's life is at risk, the state as a 'parent to the nation' (Parens Patriae) takes over the medical decision-making.

mnemonic.title: State Saves
mnemonic.expansion: S-State override. A-Autonomy ends for kids. V-Vital blood. E-Emergency court order.
